Class BinarySearchTree<E extends Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
BinaryTree<E>
BinarySearchTree<E>
Type Parameters:
E - The type of data in the tree. Must be a Comparable object.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, SearchTree<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinarySearchTreeWithRotate
public class BinarySearchTree<E extends Comparable<E>> extends BinaryTree<E> implements SearchTree<E>
Implementation of a Binary Search Tree
See Also:

      private BinaryTree.Node<E> add​(BinaryTree.Node<E> localRoot, E item)
      Recursive add method post: The data field addReturn is set to true if the item is added to the tree, false if the item is already in the tree
      Parameters:
      localRoot - The local root of the subtree
      item - The object to be inserted
      Returns:

    • delete

      private BinaryTree.Node<E> delete​(BinaryTree.Node<E> localRoot, E item)
      Recursive delete method post: The item is not in the tree; deleteReturn is equal to the deleted item as it was stored in the tree or null if the item was not found
      Parameters:
      localRoot - The root of the current subtree
      item - The item to be deleted
      Returns:
      The modified local root that does not contain the item

    • findLargestChild

      private E findLargestChild​(BinaryTree.Node<E> parent)
      Find the node that is the inorder predecessor and replace it with its left child (if any) post: the inorder predecessor is removed from the tree warning: only call on nodes with known right children
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of possible inorder predecessor
      Returns:
      The data in the inorder predecessor

      private BinaryTree.Node<E> deleteS​(BinaryTree.Node<E> localRoot, E item)
      Recursive delete method (replace with leftmost child of right subtree) post: The item is not in the tree; deleteReturn is equal to the deleted item as it was stored in the tree or null if the item was not found
